 Of course, everyone is going to find it tragic and sympathize that this couple lost their son, including those who don't agree with gay marriage. After all, lot's of people have also lost their sons and daughters in war that in fact don't hold to this couple's political views. This story well represents what has been called the 'Left's Doctrine of Infallibility'--where they use people like widows or grieving parents who have suffered tragedy in political opinion pieces to make it harder for anyone to raise other sides of the issue. In fact, this article is a CLINIC on that tactic. (It even throws in a mention of Bachmann and Pawlenty in a subtle back-handed way at one point as someone who would be 'shocked'--another indicator that there are some political ulterior motives there)
